markdownRemark.html:
Previously I was using this as a space to have some fun with Euler.

Might as well take some living notes of “Front End” in 2020.

Original:

  • Jekyll
  • JS for Euler solutions

Redesign:

  • Gatsby (supports React)

  • Publish(ed|able) solutions

    • Typescript
    • Lerna in case math utils are inter-dependent

  • Blog Components

    • Typescript as well
    • Lerna because the components will be dependent on each other
    • Storybook for easing development experience

Why that’s important:

  • It’s possible to serve storybook to view the component library
  • Components are no longer scoped to an individual project
  • Component sibling-dependencies are handled pretty well in Lerna
  • Safety, typechecking, easier development/debugging process
